THE CORPORATION OF THE CITY OF BELLEVILLE

BY-LAW NUMBER 2017-196

A BY-LAW TO AMEND BY-LAW NUMBER 2006-55 BEING A BY-LAW TO
REGULATE SIGNS AND OTHER ADVERTISING DEVICES IN THE CITY OF
BELLEVILLE

WHEREAS Section 11 of the Municipal Act, 2001, S.O. 2001, Chapter 25 as amended,
authorizes a Municipality to pass by-laws respecting signs;

AND WHEREAS the Council of the City of Belleville deems it advisable to amend By-
law Number 2006-55, the Sign By-law;

NOW THEREFORE THE COUNCIL OF THE CORPORATION OF THE CITY OF
BELLEVILLE ENACTS AS FOLLOWS:

1.

THAT Section 4.2(1)(c) of By-law Number 2006-55 is hereby amended by the
removal of the word “and” at the end of clause (iv);

THAT Section 4.2(1)(c) of By-law Number 2006-55 is hereby amended by the
deletion of clauses (v) and (vi);

That Section 4.2(1)(c) of By-law Number 2006-55 is hereby amended by the
addition of the following clauses immediately following clause (iv):

(v)
(vi)
(vii)
(viii)

(ix)
(x)

(xi)

Signs must be a minimum of 195 feet (60m) from the middle of any
intersection;

Signs shall not be permitted in any centre median;

Signs shall not be permitted between the sidewalk and the curb;

Signs shall be setback a minimum of 15 feet (4.57m) from the edge of a
driveway and any curb line or edge of the travelled portion of a street;
Signs shall be setback a minimum of 1 foot (0.3m) from a sidewalk;

Signs advertising the same candidate shall be a minimum of 33 feet (10m)
apart; and

where located on a street that is not under the jurisdiction of the
Corporation of the City of Belleville, that authorization has been obtained
from the necessary authorities.

THIS BY-LAW SHALL COME INTO FORCE AND TAKE EFFECT IMMEDIATELY ON
AND AFTER THE PASSING THEREOF.

Read a first time this 14" day of November 2017.
Read a second time this 14" day of November 2017.

Read a third time and finally passed this 14° day of November 2017.

CITY CLERK
